title: Bi-Weekly Food and Recipes Thread
selftext:
Foodies of r/India, tried out a new dish? Experimented with cooking yourself and lived to tell the story? Share here!

Feel free to share recipes, eating places, pictures, experiences etc.

**Food and Recipes Thread is posted every two weeks on Friday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Bi-Weekly+Food+and+Recipes+Thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

https://preview.redd.it/tti3fyiqw8n61.png?width=1487&format=png&auto=webp&s=899972afbc4bab665798a0f5917960a98ec4f4d5
comments: Does anyone know of a Himachli dish called 'madra'? It's a gravy made of curd and lassi and we make it in my family, but I've not come across anyone who's ever heard of this dish.

Made some yesterday. South Indian here who came on a trip and took home the name, with about 2 kgs of the rajma. The rajma we buy normally just doesn't have the same taste, so I substitute black beans in place of the rajma once I was done with the rajma I bought from there. 

I follow this recipe : https://www.vegrecipesofindia.com/rajma-madra-recipe/  .
Nice! Hope you liked it! I've never made or had it with rajma but used black eyed beans or jackfruit instead. I suggest you try with jackfruit instead of the kidney beans once.

Sure thing. You use tender jackfruit ? 

I will try with black eyed peas next.

We make it once in 2 months and love it.
I use the unripe green one.
I have, heard about it and tried it a couple of times.
